'''''Globulation 2''''' is a [[real-time strategy]] game is available in [[Software release life cycle#Beta|beta]] as of January 2009 and a final version is due to be released in the future. The game minimizes [[Micromanagement (computer gaming)|gaming micromanagement]] by automatically assigning tasks to units.<ref>[http://linux.about.com/od/softgame/fr/fr_Globulation2.htm ''Globulation 2'' review] at linux.about.com</ref><ref>[http://www.linuxjournal.com/article/7725 ''Globulation 2'' review] at linuxjournal.com</ref>
==Game modes== It can be played by a single player, through a [[local area network]] (LAN), or through the Internet via Ysagoon Online Game (YOG), a meta-server. It also features [[artificial intelligence|AI]] for playing with computer teams, a scripting language for versatile gameplay or tutorials and an integrated map editor.
''Globulation 2'' is a multi-platform (GNU/Linux distributions, BSD Unix, GNU Hurd, Apple Mac OS, Microsoft Windows, etc) free software package (released under the [[GNU General Public License]] version 3), included in several major free operating system distributions such as [[Debian]]<ref>[http://packages.debian.org/lenny/games/glob2 Debian - Details of package glob2 in lenny<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]]<ref>[http://packages.ubuntu.com/jaunty/glob2 Ubuntu - glob2<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and is rated 5 stars (out of 5) on Linux Game Tome.<ref>[http://www.happypenguin.org/show?Globulation%202 The Linux Game Tome: Globulation 2<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>In Globulation, the point is to either kill all of the enemies' units, to convert all of them to your side, or to kill the enemy by stealing their resources.
